item.title: Tree is damaged problem, 5th December
item.description:
Customer advised to speak to A. Morrey by Chelt BC. Tree has recently been installed at location. Customer is asking as a matter of urgency that the tree be re-positioned to the next corner down, as they are deeply concerned that there are too many trees in this corner of the square and there is a gap where an old tree was removed on the next corner along. Customer is also requesting site visit to discuss this matter.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Both traffic restriction signs have been driven into., 5th December
item.description:
Outside number 48 and opposite . both signs have been bent for ages but this one was driven into again last week.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Church Road, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light is not working, 5th December
item.description:
OUtside Charlton Kings Junior School, East End Road there is a street light which is not working. This is particularly dangerous at present with dark mornings and evenings and lots of children, parents and staff walking to and from school.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, East End Road, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street light opposite 9 Sunrise Avenue still not working. Engineer did come out around 2 weeks ago, but still not working., 5th December
item.description:
Opposite 9 Sunrise Avenue Bishops Cleeve. As above. Reported before, saw an engineer looking at the street lamp, but he didn’t fix it!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 9, Sunrise Avenue, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bowbridge Lane - safe walking area “pavement” please repaint, 5th December
item.description:
Photos show Bowbridge Lane looking towards and away from the junction with The Burgage. Previous white line painted on road to provide safe walking area “pavement” is worn resulting in cars passing too close to and endangering pedestrians on this narrow part of the lane. The faded line is particularly difficult to see when wet and/or dark. Please repaint this line - thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lake Street, Prestbury, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: General road marking and stud issues

item.category: Light sensor is not detecting vehicles

item.title: Blocked drainage pipe, 5th December
item.description:
Although the majority of the ditch along the side of the road is open there is a piped section, which is blocked and has been for some time. However, the amount of water we are now getting means that water is now running down the road on a regular basis and could be extremely dangerous in icy weather given the amount of traffic that uses the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Alderton, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Regular flooding across Badgeworth Road, 5th December
item.description:
The road floods regularly where the brook is. It can often be quite deep and covers the whole carriageway. It is especially dangerous for cyclists during the dark winter months.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Badgeworth Road, Badgeworth, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Leaves and debris on road, 4th December
item.description:
The winter leaves are blocking the run off of rain on the road causing deep puddles and not allowing drainage. Can they be cleared as they were today on the opposite side of the road?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 219, Gloucester Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Huge pothole near building works, 4th December
item.description:
TERRIBLE pot hole, couldn’t see in the dark and it could’ve caused serious damage. The pothole is located near the building works and past the residential area on the Old Gloucester Road. It could be dangerous and I’m lucky it’s not caused any damage (from what I can see in the dark)
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hayden Road, Springbank, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
